results.title: The Trumpet of the swan
results.creator_credit: Tiny Tot Productions, Lin Oliver, Richard Rich and Terry L Noss
results.brief_description: Louie, a Trumpeter swan born without a voice, falls in love but has no way of communicating his emotions. Feeling despondent and at odds with his siblings with wonderful calls, he leaves home on a journey where he meets a young boy called Sam and his teacher, Mrs Hammerbotham, who teaches Louie how to speak. Learning English is not the solution to Louie’s problem however as none of the other swans can understand him. A solution is reached when Louie’s father gives his son a trumpet which he begins to play proficiently. Unbeknownst to Louie though, his father has stolen the trumpet in a moment of desperation to help his son. A stint in a jazz band and a race to reclaim his now engaged childhood love, Serena, ensues in this animated adaption of E.B. White’s classic children’s tale. Features the voices of Dee Baker, Jason Alexander, Reese Witherspoon, Seth Green, Carol Burnett, Mary Steenburgen and Joe Mantegna.

results.title: The True glory
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Information, United States. Office of War Information, Carol Reed and Garson Kanin
results.brief_description: A joint British-American documentary account of the allied invasion of Europe during World War II compiled from footage shot by nearly 1400 cameramen. Introduced by General Eisenhower it covers all the major events of the war in Europe from the Normandy landings to the fall of Berlin. Cast includes Dwight D. Eisenhower (as himself), Robert Harris (commentator) and Peter Ustinov (as himself). (Award: Best Documentary, Features 1946 Academy Awards)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Great Britain. Ministry of Information, United States. Office of War Information, Carol Reed and Garson Kanin

results.title: The Trouble with Harry [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: The trouble with Harry is that he’s dead, and while nobody else seems to mind, everybody thinks they are responsible for his death. After many burials and unearthings of the corpse, and a few blossoming romances between the major characters, the real cause of Harry’s death is revealed, and Harry troubles nobody again. “The Trouble with Harry” is a quirky comedy-mystery set in then autumnal splendour of New England. It is a decidedly different film from Hitchcock, in which Shirley Maclaine makes her screen debut. Includes music score by Bernard Herrmann. Cast includes Edmund Gwen, John Forsythe, Mildred Natwick and Jerry Mathers. Screenplay by John Michael Hayes, based on the novel by Jack Trevor Story. Cinematography by Robert Burks. Edited by Alma Macrorie. Music by Bernard Herrmann.

results.title: The Trojan women
results.brief_description: A joint Greek and American production based on Euripedes’ play “The Trojan women”. Katharine Hepburn is Hecube, the wife of King Priam; Vanessa Redgrave is Andromache, the widow of Hector; Genevieve Bujold is Cassandra, the cursed prophetess of Apollo and Trojan Princess and Irene Papas is the beautiful Helen of Troy. The victors of the Trojan war ransack the city and take as part of their spoils, the women and children. The play tells of their bitter struggle to survive the cruelty of defeat and capture.

results.title: The Tree of wooden clogs = L'albero degli zoccoli
results.creator_credit: Radiotelevisione Italiana, Ital-Noleggio Cinematografico, GPC and Ermanno Olmi
results.brief_description: Scenes from the lives of three peasant families, living in the same farmhouse in Lombardy at the end of the nineteenth century, are chronicled over the course of a year. Their struggles to survive are slowly revealed in a mosaic of small, but detailed incidents which poignantly capture the repetitive drudgery and occasional joys of the exploited peasant class in rural Italy. Following the tradition of Italian neo-realist cinema, Olmi drew on a large ensemble cast of non-professional actors and shot the film on 16mm in a lyrical documentary style. The muted colour and straight-on, eye-level cinematography captures the striking beauty of the Italian countryside through the seasons without diminishing or romanticising the lives of the peasants who work it. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Treasure of Sierra Madre
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Henry Blanke and John Huston
results.brief_description: John Huston won Academy Awards both as director and writer of this film. Based on B. Traven’s novel, it reveals the effects of greed and the lure of sudden wealth on three penniless prospectors. Humphrey Bogart, as Fred C. Dobbs, gives one of the best performances of his career. We watch him change from a likeable drifter into a man capable of killing his best friend in cold blood.

results.title: The Towering inferno
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Irwin Allen and John Guillermin
results.brief_description: A skyscraper and am all-star cast go up in flames in this classic 70s disaster movie. To celebrate the construction of the Glass Tower, the world’s tallest building, architect Doug Roberts and builder James Duncan hold a gala event on the highest floors. The trouble is that Duncan’s son-in-law and electrical subcontractor, Roger Simmons, installed faulty wiring throughout the 138-story tower to save money. While the town VIPs enjoy the party, a security guard wonders why his equipment is malfunctioning, only to discover that a burnt-out circuit breaker has ignited some rubbish on the 85th floor, which is swiftly turning the skyscraper into a “towering inferno”. It is then up to Roberts and Fire Chief O’Hallorhan to find a way to stop the blaze. Cast includes Steve McQueen, Paul Newman, William Holden, Faye Dunaway, Fred Astaire, Richard Chamberlain, Jennifer Jones, O.J. Simpson, Robert Vaughn, Robert Wagner and more…

results.title: The Tin drum
results.creator_credit: New World Pictures, Franz Seitz and Volker Schlondorff
results.brief_description: Winner of an Academy Award for best foreign film, this is the story of Oskar, a small boy, born into the feast and famine, the facism and slaughter of Germany during the rise of Hitler and the Third Reich. At three, he’d already had enough of this violent and confused world and decides he’d be better off to remain a three-year-old forever. Incredibly, he remains frozen in size and faces life with two weapons… his tin drum- which he bangs to drown out horror and lies… and his childish voice which he raises to a piercing shriek which breaks glass. German language with English subtitles.

results.title: The Times of Harvey Milk
results.creator_credit: Black Sand Productions, Richard Schmiechen and Robert Epstein
results.brief_description: An exceptionally moving documentary about Harvey Milk, the first openly gay candidate elected to San Francisco’s Board of Supervisors. A courageous activist, Milk worked hard to express the political concerns of not only gays and lesbians, but also of African-Americans, Hispanics and other so- called American minorities. After 11 months in office, Milk and the Mayor of San Francisco were assassinated by Dan White, a conservative member of the Board of Supervisors. The subsequent trial, in which White received a lenient sentence, resulted in massive rioting in San Francisco by gay and lesbian activists. Amidst the tragedy the film builds a convincing and impassioned picture of a man committed to human rights and human dignity. (Awards: Academy Award winner for best documentary, 1985)
